summary: This is an email exchange between a defense attorney and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The AUSA confirms the FBI seized approximately 3,500 nude and 40,000 non-nude images during searches in New York and the Virgin Islands, and details the process for making them available for review at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document is correspondence regarding discovery in her criminal case. She is referred to as 'your client' and is incarcerated at the MDC.

events.title: FBI Seizure of Images
events.description: The FBI seized approximately 3,500 nude images and 40,000 non-nude images during searches conducted in New York and the Virgin Islands.

events.title: Discovery Production Update
events.description: The prosecution informs the defense that a new discovery production is ready for pickup and that a laptop containing seized images will be prepared for review at the MDC the following week.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The FBI seized approximately 43,500 images (3,500 nude, 40,000 non-nude) during searches in New York and the Virgin Islands.
The prosecution was preparing a secure laptop with these images for Ghislaine Maxwell to review at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
The correspondence is dated October 2020, during the pre-trial discovery phase of Maxwell's criminal case.
The document is official correspondence between defense counsel and an Assistant United States Attorney.
The volume of seized visual material indicates the scale of the investigative evidence gathered.
